ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned generally about earth science, climate change, ocean thermodynamics, etc

Several concepts in earth and environmental physics (planetary formation, heat conduction, plate layer formation, Rayleigh number, Peclet number, Rossby number, geophysical fluid dynamics, Navier-Stokes equations, etc.)

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A strength of the course is the breadth of material it covers. A weakness is that it is all very subjective material, so what is taught is simply the opinion of the professor, which can make it very difficult to find guidance / clarification via the internet or textbooks. The course was also taught remotely, which made it a bit difficult to take in the information.

Strengths: lectures were recorded, so we had access to watch them again. Also, Jonas was incredibly helpful as a TA.
Weaknesses: sometimes lectures could be hard to follow and Professor Wettlaufer did not pause often to answer questions.

Lectures were well organized and I was really interested in the topics covered in the course. However, I didn't feel like the lecture prepared us for some of the questions on the problem sets and midterms. It would've been helpful to have readings to cover the concepts or maybe a bit more preparation for how we would be applying the things we derived in class, because I ended up feeling somewhat dependent on the teaching fellow's discussion section to go over concepts that we were being assessed on. Also, the problem sets and midterms were sporadically assigned and that part of the class did not feel well organized.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I personally would not recommend this course to another student. It seems to require a great deal of physics intuition that is not well-reflected in the pre requisites. Also, there are better science credits out there that serve the same purpose.
It might be very difficult for a student to follow if they do not have a strong background in partial differential equations, calculus, basic mechanics, and fundamental fluid mechanics.
Probably not. I don't feel like the knowledge I took away from the course was worth the amount of stress it caused me.
